page.title: 02CHESHIRE WORKSHOPS. (Part 1)
page.content: The Candle Factory is on its own in the countryside,its made of red sandstone. There is a huge carpark,a fish pond, a barbeque, an adventure play area, an incinerator for rubbish and a building where children can make candles. It was started in 1972 by Anne Sanderson as a hobby. She made sand candles _( pour hot wax into a hole in sand, cut patterns in the outside when it is set.) She also made candles by handcarving warm wax and twisting and curling the strips and this is now done by a team of girls. They can make 15 big ones a day and up to 150 small ones; it was a rediscovered 17th century craft. The latest sort is flower candles with real pressed flowers on the outside of the candle.
